channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Gary Lineker mocks Tim Davie's BBC social media crackdown
item.description: The vocal Match of the Day presenter suggested he was not worried by Tim Davie's anti-bias drive, launched in a speech in Cardiff yesterday.

item.title: Alexander Payne denies raping Rose McGowan when she was 15
item.description: Alexander Payne (right), 59, the Oscar-winning director, has denied claims by Rose McGowan (left), 46, that he raped the actress when she was just 15 years old.

item.title: Driver who plowed into BLM protesters in Times Square 'attended a Keep America Great rally'
item.description: The man - who has not yet been publicly named - was caught on camera driving his black Ford Taurus sedan into the crowd in Times Square shortly after 8pm on Thursday.

item.title: Tyler Perry builds massive Atlanta mansion fit for a billionaire
item.description: Film producer Tyler Perry, 50, best known for the hit Madea movies, is building a massive mansion outside of Atlanta, befitting of his new billionaire status.

item.title: Tycoon, 57, loses court battle with mother of his five children
item.description: Mr Justice Cobb said Peter Andreewitch, 57, used his intellect to 'control' French former partner Magali Moutreuil, 44, and consigned her to a 'subservient role'.

item.title: Dover MP warns rival far-right and pro-migrant groups to stay away
item.description: Dover MP Natalie Elphicke has urged people to stay away from the protests given the backdrop of the Covid-19 pandemic, saying while people have a right to protest, now is not a sensible time.

item.title: Extinction Rebellion activists glue themselves to London pavements
item.description: Protesters glued themselves to the ground outside the Department of Transport, Westminster, in a demonstration against High Speed 2 (HS2) railway.

item.title: Leeds is on brink of lockdown: Nearly half-a-million people in West Yorkshire city face restrictions
item.description: New figures show the West Yorkshire city's seven day infection rate has risen to 32.4 cases for every 100,000 people in the city - moving it on to a list with some of worst affected cities in the UK.

item.title: German woman smothered five of her children after split from husband
item.description: The woman, known only as Christiane K, is from Solingen in North Rhine-Westphalia. Investigators believe she became depressed after splitting from her third husband.

item.title: One in five parents STILL aren't sending their children back to school
item.description: The majority of headteachers are reporting an attendance of more than 80% among the pupils in England returning to the classroom this week, suggesting one in five are not yet back.

item.title: JCB-sponsored academy in Staffordshire is first school to close due to a confirmed coronavirus case
item.description: The JCB Academy in Rochester, Staffordshire, was one of the first schools to welcome pupils back at the end of August but told children to stay at home today after a 'single case' of coronavirus.

item.title: Two girls are orphaned after losing both their 'utterly devoted' parents in head-on crash
item.description: Robert Bateman, 36, and his 35-year-old wife Paula died when their Ford Focus was in collision with an Iveco Daily van in Cambridgeshire.

item.title: Woman severely burned by hand sanitizer exploding as she lit candle
item.description: Katie Wise was at home with her three daughters in Texas on Sunday when an accident involving a bottle of off-brand hand sanitizer led to an explosion and left her with second- and third-degree burns.

item.title: Former Premier League footballer Jermaine Johnson shot in Jamaica
item.description: Former premier league footballer Jermaine Johnson was shot and wounded in a drive-by attack on Thursday evening in Kingston, Jamaica, pictured.

item.title: Man shocks wife with 12-ft replica T-REX dinosaur on the patio
item.description: Adrian Shaw, 52, came up with the idea after wife Deborah, 53, nagged him to clean up the back garden of their home in Leamington Spa, Warwickshire.

item.title: Investigators probing the death of mother killed by a speedboat in Corfu make 'suspicious finding'
item.description: Claire Glatman died while taking her daily swim from an idyllic beach next to the luxury villa which she and her millionaire property developer husband Mark, 63, own in Avlaki in the north of Corfu.

item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell got a visit from her lawyers that was THREE TIMES longer than usual
item.description: Ghislaine Maxwell met two of her lawyers on August 28 at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn, court documents reveal. The meeting lasted three hours.

item.title: Tony Abbott appointed UK trade envoy despite backlash
item.description: Former Australian prime minister Tony Abbott has been appointed to the UK Government's relaunched Board of Trade despite a furious backlash.

item.title: White House fights back against claims Donald Trump called WWI Marine heroes 'losers'
item.description: White House aides mounted furious pushback following the release of an Atlantic article that reported Trump called deceased veterans 'losers' - and even quoting John Bolton to do so.

item.title: Voyeur, 41, who filmed naked woman asleep in hotel avoids jail
item.description: Emily Hunt, 41, woke up at the five-star Town Hall Hotel in London with no previous memory of the night before next to stranger Christopher Killick, also 41, in May 2015.

item.title: Yorkshire jobseeker, 63, wears suit and hands out CVs at station
item.description: Trevor Walford, 63, from Keighley in West Yorkshire applied for hundreds of roles online before deciding to hand out his CV at Leeds railway station. He is a former restaurant manager.

item.title: Lionel Messi will STAY at Barcelona despite star's father Jorge's statement on release clause
item.description: PETE JENSON IN SPAIN: The superstar's bombshell U-turn was officially announced on Friday evening. Messi confirmed he is abandoning attempts at a move in a recorded interview.

item.title: Neighbours mercilessly troll homeowner who tried to block their access to a walkway
item.description: Locals in Dorking, Surrey, were left stunned when a large 'no access' sign appeared on the lane, sparking a response from the 'Phantom Poster Printer'.

item.title: Sadiq Khan calls drive to get workers back to office 'OFFENSIVE'
item.description: The Mayor of London made the comments while with a group of 80 key workers invited to play tennis at Wimbledon (pictured today) as part of efforts to thank them for their work.

item.title: Ed Sheeran's local pub is forced to close after worker tests positive for coronavirus
item.description: A worker at The Dennington Queen, in Dennington, near Woodbridge in Suffolk, has tested positive and has now shut until further notice.

item.title: Doctor, 36, jailed for 13 months for three-month stalking campaign against TV explorer Levison Wood
item.description: Fiza Jabeen, 36, from Harborne in Birmingham, began sending 'explicit and unpleasant' messages to Levison Wood on his Instagram and Twitter accounts in April of this year.

item.title: Lockdown-free Sweden's coronavirus case rate is now lower than Nordic neighbours Denmark and Norway
item.description: For the first time since March, Sweden's infection rater per million people (12) dropped below that of its Nordic neighbours Denmark (18) and Norway (14), after not locking down during the pandemic.

item.title: Tourist swears at Indian policeman asking her to wear face mask
item.description: A tourist in Uttarakhand, India, told a police officer she didn't 'give a f***' when given a spot fine for not wearing any PPE while in a public space and claimed coronavirus 'doesn't exist'.

item.title: Stephen Hawking's second wife Elaine once raged in front guests that she was his 'slave',
item.description: The claims are made by Leonard Mlodinow in his new book Stephen Hawking: A Memoir of Friendship and Physics, released on September 8.

item.title: Tributes to popular YouTube star Lloyd Cafe Cadena as he dies at the age of 26
item.description: Fans have been left devastated after YouTube star Lloyd Cafe Cadena died at the age of 26. The Filipino content creator had more than five million subscribers on the video sharing website.

item.title: Father who spent his life savings on dream home says the estate looks like a scene from Aleppo'
item.description: A dad who spent his life savings on his dream home claims the new-build estate it is on looks 'like a scene out of Aleppo' after the house was dogged with problems. Mark says Heathlands is a dump.

item.title: London Fashion Week to see return of LIVE catwalk shows this month
item.description: The British Fashion Council has announced that London Fashion Week will see the return of live catwalk shows, according to France24.

item.title: No10 'believes there is 30 to 40 per cent chance of Brexit trade deal'
item.description: Downing Street believes the UK has a one in three chance of striking a comprehensive free trade deal with the European Union by the end of the year, it was claimed today.

item.title: Vladimir Putin's oligarch pal resumes bitter divorce battle with ex-wife in court over his fortune
item.description: Wealthy Russian businessman Arkady Rotenberg, a former judo partner of Russian President Vladimir Putin, and his ex-wife Natalia began fighting over money in 2014 in London.

item.title: More 'green time' and less screen time 'helps children's mental health'
item.description: A review of 186 studies found time spent in woods, parks and nature reserves positively affects both kids' psychological well-being and academic achievement.

item.title: Inequality in the workplace reduces employees' motivation - even among those who stand to benefit
item.description: British researchers found that disparities in the rewards given to different people for completing the same task reduce people's happiness.

item.title: Brain changes in astronauts due to micro-gravity are only temporary, study finds
item.description: Scientists who analysed of the brains of 11 male astronauts who spent an average of about six months in space found no evidence of neuro-degeneration or loss of brain tissue

item.title: Jane Garvey announces she is leaving BBC Radio 4's Woman's Hour after 13 years
item.description: Jane Garvey is quitting Woman's Hour, announcing her departure weeks after Dame Jenni Murray said she was leaving the show - but laughed suggestion a man should replace her.

item.title: Charlie Hebdo terror suspect denies involvement in massacre
item.description: Primary suspect Ali Riza Polat has today denied any responsibility for the attacks. He is being represented by Isabelle Coutant-Peyre (pictured), who defended terrorist Ilich Ramirez Sanche

item.title: British woman, 40, who announced on live TV she would end life at Dignitas finds miracle cure
item.description: Jennie Thornton, 40, from Buckinghamshire, fell seriously ill earlier this year with a 30 per cent lung infection and feared that she could be killed if she were to catch coronavirus.

item.title: Drag socials banned by university student union in fear they are being used to ridicule trans people
item.description: Student representatives at Aberystwyth University said that people attending the events were trying to be 'as funny as possible'.

item.title: Wales hits back at Grant Shapps in quarantine list row
item.description: Vaughan Gething (pictured) said there had been a 'rising tide of infections' coming from the Greek islands and insisted the measure had been imposed to keep Wales safe.

item.title: Jilted wife comforts husband ditched by woman after he left her
item.description: A British woman asked Reddit for advice after her American husband left her for someone else, less than a year after they got married. She explained that he has been asking her for emotional support.

item.title: World's oceans soak up MORE carbon than previously thought
item.description: Researchers from the University of Exeter factored water temperature at different depths into their calculations and found it made a significant impact.

item.title: Dune 'IT' sandals of the summer have finally been re-stocked
item.description: Dune London has announced the return of its Double Strap Flat Lockstock sandals. The 'ugly dad' sandals sold out at the beginning of summer after proving popular with influencers.

item.title: Quarantine period 'could be HALVED to a if airport testing for coronavirus introduced'
item.description: MPs voiced frustration as Boris Johnson again poured cold water on the idea, despite desperate pleas to prevent the 'demise' of the aviation sector.

item.title: Married teacher, 35, accused of having sex with boy, 15, in a field
item.description: Headmaster Nicholas Simms said the boy acted in a surprised way when he spoke to him in January 2019 over rumours circulating at Princes Risborough School in Buckinghamshire.

item.title: Furious restaurant boss brands Andy Carroll a 'c***' in angry note
item.description: Calvin Kitchin, owner of Cal's Own in Jesmond, left a handwritten note on the footballer's car, branding him a 'rich f***ing c***' with a sense of entitlement.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: 1,940 new cases in biggest surge since MAY
item.description: The 1,940 cases diagnosed today is the highest since May 30, when 2,445 people tested positive for the disease. A further 10 people are confirmed to have died of Covid-19 in the UK.

item.title: Family's BMW is washed out to sea after it was left parked on Cornwall beach
item.description: These pictures show a car being washed out to sea after the driver left it parked overnight - on a BEACH.The silver BMW was abandoned on St Agnes beach in Cornwall, according to witnesses.

item.title: Miss England finalist scared to go out alone after stalker released
item.description: Trainee school teacher Samantha Bumford, 27, said she saw Jonathan Deal while she was driving after he was released from prison last year. Deal was jailed twice for harassing the 27-year-old

item.title: Clergyman's ex-wife may lose home to pay his legal bills due to her vendetta
item.description: Jean Gibbs, from Norfolk, pictured, has been ordered to put her house up for sale by a High Court judge to pay the legal bills of her ex-husband Rev Charles Gibbs, who she falsely alleged abused their son.

item.title: Panicking crew battled to save stricken live export ship as stormy China sea poured into the vessel
item.description: Terrified crewmen fought in vain to save a stricken live export ship carrying nearly 6,000 cows off China as stormy seas rushed into the vessel. Only one survivor from sinking found.

item.title: Chimpanzee, 43, cradles baby after giving birth at Chester Zoo
item.description: The baby chimpanzee was born on August 21 at Chester zoo. It has been described as a 'hugely significant' moment for the subspecies which numbers less than 18,000 in the wild.

item.title: Uber launches UK car rental service allowing customers to book and hire vehicles
item.description: The service, called Uber Rent, has previously been piloted in France and Australia. Users will be able to browse a marketplace of cars before booking a vehicle.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Rishi Sunak risks Tory rebellion over Budget
item.description: David Davis today became the first Tory MP to publicly warn he will vote against Rishi Sunak's Budget if it includes tax hikes.

item.title: Virgin Atlantic will axe another 1,150 jobs taking total losses during pandemic to 4,700
item.description: Virgin Atlantic, which has secured £1,2bn rescue deal, confirmed it could axe a further 1,150 jobs from across the company taking the total number of job losses to 4,700 during the coronavirus crisis.

item.title: Watchdog threatens to sue UK's four largest housebuilders over misleading leasehold contracts
item.description: Barratt Developments, Persimmon Homes, Taylor Wimpey and Countryside Properties will be investigated by the Competition and Markets Authority (CMA).

item.title: London council FINES drivers £130 for using roads without a permit
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Hammersmith and Fulham Council has banned drivers from outside the London borough driving down six roads which it claims are being used as rat runs.

item.title: UK tourists' fury as government keeps Portugal on safe travel list
item.description: Families have told of their agony after paying huge prices to get home from Portugal to beat a heavily-hinted new quarantine - only for the restriction to never appear

item.title: Joe Biden claims a black man invested the light bulb, 'not a white guy named Edison'
item.description: Joe Biden said on Thursday that a black man created the light bulb, 'not a white guy named [Thomas] Edison during a speech before community leaders in Kenosha, Wisconsin

item.title: Coronavirus infection rate in England 'remains stable'
item.description: There are now 2,000 new cases each day, on average - down 200 from last Friday, when 2,200 infections were recorded - according to the Office for National Statistics.

item.title: Coronavirus: Children's risk of infection at school 'extremely low'
item.description: The study looked at children across English primary and preschools in June and early July. Of 12,026 adults and children, just three tested positive for Covid-19, including one child.

item.title: Schoolboy dubbed a 'hero' after jumping behind the wheel to drive his grandmother to medical help
item.description: Schoolboy PJ Brewer-Laye, who lives in Indianapolis, has been praised for his heroism after he drove his grandmother Angela Brewer-Laye, to get medical help.

item.title: Free cannabis rained down on the streets of Tel Aviv thanks to a group looking to legalise marijuana
item.description: People in Tel Aviv grabbed packets of free cannabis as a protest group dropped packets of the drug from a drone. Two suspects were later arrested by the police for the incident.

item.title: Birmingham council plans to enforce diversity 'Rooney Rule'
item.description: The local authority was recently criticised for the lack of diversity among its own senior management, despite representing a city of 1.1 million people, just under half of whom are from ethnic minorities.

item.title: Chinese teacher forces her pupils to keep books balanced on their heads to 'fix their bad postures'
item.description: Footage shows the children, each with a textbook laying on top of their heads, working in the classroom at a primary school in Nanyang of central Chinese province Henan.

item.title: Paedophile rugby coach, 25, avoids jail after grooming schoolgirls and asking them for sex
item.description: Rugby coach James Dowle groomed two underage girls with sex chats after coaching the female teams. The 25-year-old has been handed a suspended prison sentence

item.title: Matt Le Tissier faces huge backlash after sharing image of holocaust victim Anne Frank
item.description: Just a week after being axed by Sky Sports, Matt Le Tissier is once again causing a storm on social media with his bold views. Le Tissier posted a picture of Anne Frank, before then backtracking.

item.title: Aston Martin reveals one-of-a-kind £2m Victor hypercar
item.description: The Victor has been created by Aston Martin's Bond-inspired Q division and uses a 7.3-litre naturally-aspirated V12 engine that produces 836bhp and comes with a manual gearbox.

item.title: British tourist makes tube of Pringles last four hours to avoid wearing coronavirus face mask
item.description: Holidaymaker Michael Richards, 41, bought the tube of salt and vinegar Pringles on board the easyJet flight to Tenerife and nibbled on one every two-and-a-half minutes.

item.title: Revealed! The new It boys on the block
item.description: Tatler magazine has revealed the new generation of 'society studs' - from the 'sporty squire' to the 'long-haired looker' and business beaux.'

item.title: On second thought! Hilarious photos capture the perfectly timed snaps that trick the eyes
item.description: Shareably rounded up a selection of the funniest optical illusion images from around the world that have been shared on social media because they deceive the eyes on first glance.

item.title: Police are investigating whether German Madeleine McCann suspect carried out a perverted attack
item.description: Christian Brueckner allegedly grabbed a 10-year-old girl and masturbated in front of her on Salema beach, Portugal, in April 2007 - just weeks before Madeleine disappeared.

item.title: Strictly's Nicola Adams enjoys break in Mykonos with girlfriend after making history
item.description: The boxer appeared in high spirits as she enjoyed a trip to Mykonos with girlfriend Ella Baig, after being announced as the first Strictly star to be in a same-sex couple

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Boris Johnson 'hosted room packed with Tory MPs'
item.description: Boris Johnson today faced accusations of breaking his own social distancing rules after it was claimed he addressed a roomful of Tory MPs who were packed in 'cheek by jowl'.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Just 24% have confidence in quarantine rules
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: A poll for MailOnline by Redfield & Wilton Strategies found people are running out of patience with the quarantine regime, with just 24 per cent saying it is working.

item.title: Are people in Africa being protected from Covid-19 by POVERTY?
item.description: Experts have been puzzled by why some nations, particularly in Africa, are not suffering massive outbreaks, describing the phenomenon as a 'complete enigma'.

item.title: 57% of employees say they travelled to the office in the past seven days
item.description: More than half of Britain's working adults say they have travelled to the office in the past week, according to a new survey, as employees begin to make their way back to their desks after lockdown.

item.title: Ineos Grenadier 'almost certain' to be built in France, not Wales
item.description: He said a deal to build the 4X4 at an ex-Daimler factory in Hambach, France, is 'pretty much' decided, dealing a huge blow to Bridgend, Wales, where the car was due to be produced.

item.title: This is Money's Fantasy Share Picking Game: Play to win £28k of prizes
item.description: Our game is back for a second year and we are offering readers the chance to win a £15,000 top prize, £5,000 and £2,000 runners-up prizes and twelve £500 weekly prizes.

item.title: Boy, 3, was found 'blue' in his bed after developing 'extraordinarily rare' brain condition
item.description: Toddler Frankie Grogan died suddenly in his sleep after suffering from seizures and developing an 'extraordinarily rare' brain condition, an inquest heard. Doctors hadn't heard of the condition.

item.title: Alexei Navalny poisoning 'strengthens Russia' says Novichok survivor
item.description: Charlie, 47, spent weeks in hospital and still suffers with the effects of his contact with the deadly substance. His partner Dawn Sturgess died after being exposed to the nerve agent in July 2018

item.title: From hope to horror: Vivid artwork by freezer killer's victim gives glimpse into her once-happy life
item.description: Heartbreaking artwork and writings from one of the victims of freezer killer Zahid Younis has emerged showing her once happy life with her murderer. Henriett Szucs' pictures showed her great talent

item.title: Prince William thanks the emergency services as he joins a special online thanksgiving service
item.description: The Duke of Cambridge, 38, warmly thanked emergency services for their efforts during the covid-19 pandemic during an online thanksgiving service to honour 999 heroes today.

item.title: Policeman PEPPER SPRAYS man without mask for resisting arrest
item.description: The shocking footage shows the clash between then passenger and the lone officer after the man refused to wear a face covering on the Wirral line service at Lime Street Station in Liverpool.

item.title: Fire engines battle huge blaze with giant 'mushroom cloud' at industrial building near holiday park
item.description: Firefighters were called to the scene in Vicarage Lane in Hoo, near Rochester in Kent, at 4.30am on Friday, where flames and a plume of black smoke could be seen.

item.title: Meghan Markle and Prince Harry 'DIDN'T tell Queen of Netflix deal'
item.description: According to The Sun, the Duke, 35, and the Duchess of Sussex, 39, who recently bought a $14million mansion in Santa Barbara, failed to tell the Queen about their new deal with Netflix.

item.title: Human bones found in Suffolk river are NOT remains of RAF gunner Corrie McKeague
item.description: Nicola Urquhart said she had been 'trying to keep a sensible head on' while police were unable to reassure her that human remains found in the River Stour in Sudbury last week were not her son's.

item.title: Archaeology: Remains of a 2,500-year-old royal palace found buried outside the walls of Jerusalem
item.description: The palace would have overlooked King Solomon's Temple in the heart of Jerusalem, but is believed to have been destroyed in 586 BC.

item.title: BBC rules Emily Maitlis's Newsnight rant 'breached impartiality'
item.description: The Editorial Complaints Unit (ECU) said the loaded rant 'placed the presenter closer to one side of the debate' over the behaviour of Boris Johnson's chief adviser.

item.title: Coronavirus: Obese people's immune systems put under more strain
item.description: The report by the University of Michigan found that obesity causes a long-lasting activation of some parts of the immune system in a way that can be harmful.

item.title: Oxford's coronavirus vaccine enters human trials in Japan
item.description: UK drug giant AstraZeneca, which owns the rights to the vaccine, announced on Friday that it is beginning Phase 1/2 clinical trials across 250 patients in Japan.

item.title: Heston Blumenthal launches a Mediterranean gin in Waitrose range
item.description: The Lazy Sunshine Gin costs £25 for a 70cl bottle and will be available in Waitrose from today. The spirit is said to be inspired by the London-born chef's fondness of the south of France.

item.title: Tabby cat survives in shipping container for TWO MONTHS
item.description: Monty's distraught owner Beverley Chapman, 59, had all but given up hope of ever seeing the family pet again after he went missing from her home in Helston, Cornwall.

item.title: Terrifying moment a mother throws her children to safety from her burning third-floor flat
item.description: A dramatic video caught the moment a mother, 25, was forced to throw her two young children from a third floor window to save their lives in an inferno in the Russian city of Novosibirsk.

item.title: Adventure-loving couple pose for wedding photos on the edge of a CLIFF
item.description: Ryan, 30, and Skye Myers, 28, from Mountain Home, Arkansas, wanted a big ceremony but had to change their plans due to coronavirus restrictions.

item.title: Emily Hartridge was riding e-scooter too fast with an underinflated tyre when she was killed
item.description: The YouTube star, 35, died instantly of her injuries following the collision in Battersea, south London last July as she was on her way to a fertility clinic.

item.title: Ageless woman, 51, says she's mistaken for her daughters' SISTER
item.description: Rebecca Daubler, from Atlanta, Georgia, went through a divorce at age 40 that inspired her to focus more on her personal health and wellness.

item.title: Brazil reaches four million cases of coronavirus amid hopes that infections are starting to slow
item.description: The latest rise of 43,773 cases brought the total to 4.04million, while another 834 fatalities took the death toll to more than 124,000.

item.title: Prince William and Kate Middleton went to Ibiza superclub Pacha
item.description: Prince William and Kate Middleton, both 38, went to an Ibiza superclub during a wild trip to the party isle, Ibiza party organiser Tony Truman has revealed on Instagram.

item.title: Boris Johnson's new personal trainer in two-year £2,500 cash row
item.description: Harry Jameson, seen jogging recently with Boris Johnson, was ordered in May to pay back £2,540 to a London lawyer after a two year dispute over unused exercises classes.

item.title: Hot days causes air pollution from asphalt, study claims
item.description: Yale researchers found chemical emissions from asphalt produce greater quantities of secondary organic aerosols - small particles with public health effects - under summertime conditions.

item.title: Girl, 3, raped and murdered in India due to feud between families
item.description: A man has been arrested after the body of a three-year-old girl was found raped and strangled in an Indian field. It is the third such similar incident in the are in just 20-days

item.title: Young woman makes out with her own FATHER for $1,000 on live radio
item.description: A young woman passionately kissed her own father in a live breakfast radio segment on Friday.

item.title: TREK and Trace: Route-planner's 'walk on water' system forces families on near 500-mile round-trips
item.description: The mapping system used by coronavirus test and trace system is sending people on near 500-mile journeys - because it measures the nearest centre 'as the crow flies'

item.title: How Germany has tested thousands of air passengers for coronavirus
item.description: Travellers from high-risk areas have been getting free, compulsory coronavirus tests at German airports (pictured at Hamburg Airport) since August 8.

item.title: Superdrug mocked over sanitary products for 'people who menstruate'
item.description: Superdrug has been accused of 'female erasure' after it launched the £3.99 Luna sanitary towels which say they are for 'people who menstruate' instead of 'women'.

item.title: Mother spotted taking her one-week-old baby for a walk in a carrier bag in Ukraine
item.description: The unnamed woman, 29, was spotted by shocked passers-by in the capital city of Kyiv on Wednesday.

item.title: Homeowner transforms avocado bathroom to modern masterpiece for £300
item.description: Neil Painter, 36, and wife Katie, 32, from Marston Green, Birmingham, bought a new home at the upper limit of their budget, but didn't want to live with the outdated decor while saving for renovations.

item.title: Macaque rifles through tourist's backpack and steals his passport during wedding trip to Gibraltar
item.description: A macaque monkey climbed onto an excited groom in Gibraltar and rifled through his belongings before tossing aside his passport and birth certificate - nearly ruining the wedding.

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg warns to expect 'violence and civil unrest' before election result becomes clear
item.description: Mark Zuckerberg warned there could civil unrest and violence this November if the result of the election is not immediately known and said they are making sure that it will not be organized via Facebook.

item.title: Groom-to-be drowns five minutes after getting engaged
item.description: Larissa Campos, 25, is mourning the loss of her fiancé Joao Guilherme Torres Fadini, 24 who drowned at the Itupararanga Dam in Brazil, moments after their engagement shoot.

item.title: Three Chinese families on different floors all became infected after virus spread through plumbing
item.description: Four members of a family-of-five living on the 15th floor of the apartment in Guangzhou, had recently returned home from Wuhan when two middle aged couples on the 25th and 27th floors became ill.

item.title: Pictured: One-year-old toddler found near body of mother who starved
item.description: Mercy Baguma, 34, was found dead with her baby Adriel beside her at a flat in Govan, Glasgow, after her partner Eric Nnanna, 30, had gone to the flat but got no response and heard the baby crying.

item.title: Taiwan denies shooting down a Chinese Su-35 fighter jet after footage shows crashed plane on fire
item.description: Footage emerged on Twitter shows the wreckage engulfed in flames. Taiwan's Ministry of National Defence said the claim of it shooting down a Chinese Su-35 fighter jet was untrue.

item.title: Terminally ill Frenchman will livestream his death on social media
item.description: Alain Cocq, who suffers from a rare condition where the walls of the arteries stick together, said he would livestream his death on Facebook from Saturday morning.

item.title: Woman who was surrounded by BLM protesters in viral video condemns 'bullying' tactics
item.description: Lauren B. Victor, a 49-year-old urban planner, was aggressively heckled by marchers on August 24, while she was dining with a friend in the Adams Morgan district of Washington D.C.

item.title: Teen suffered second degree burns after his portable phone charger exploded
item.description: Colton Pingree, 15, from Tuolumne, California, was left with second degree burns that 'melted' his skin on his arm and back after his battery pack exploded and knocked him off his bed.

item.title: The Queen is set to open her Sandringham Estate to the public as a drive-in cinema
item.description: Her Majesty, 94, will open up Sandringham Estate to the public as a drive-in cinema, which will cost £32.50 per car. The showings will run from 25-27th September and will kick off with 1917.

item.title: Italy's former PM Silvio Berlusconi, 83, is hospitalised with 'the early stages of double pneumonia'
item.description: Silvio Berlusconi, 83, who has a history of heart and other medical problems, went to hospital in Milan 'as a precaution' on Thursday night, two days after testing positive for the coronavirus.

item.title: Moonwalkies! Adorable moment German shepherd spins around and walks backwards into bedroom in Texas
item.description: Eight-year-old German shepherd Jackson has developed his own way of entering rooms. Owner Madeleine Fonteneau filmed him spin round and reverse through a doorway at their home in Texas.

item.title: Boris Johnson pressured to drop plans to give former Australia PM Tony Abbott a Brexit trade role
item.description: Former Australian Prime Minister Tony Abbott admitted this week to having 'discussions with members of the British government' but stressed 'there is nothing official as yet'.

item.title: Women are better than men at coping with shift work because 'their body clocks are set differently'
item.description: Women are more resilient to disruptions in circadian rhythms - making them better suited to shift work and less susceptible to jet lag when travelling around the world.

item.title: RICHARD LITTLEJOHN: It's not just the airlines - UK plc is in a tailspin as well
item.description: RICHARD LITTLEJOHN: New BBC director-general Tim Davie might have overturned the ban on singing patriotic songs at the Proms. Yet what's the when the country is still cowering in its shell?

item.title: North Korean defector describes eating insects and seeing 'bodies on the street'
item.description: Yeonmi Park said cold, darkness and starvation were part of everyday life in North Korea and blamed the regime's nuclear ambitions for wrecking the country's economy.

item.title: Bride-to-be's mum says she 'can't afford to put any weight on' in Say Yes To The Dress Lancashire
item.description: In tonight's episode of TLC's Say Yes To The Dress Lancashire, bride-to-be Gemma is taken aback by her outspoken mum Sue - who slams one of the 'clingy' dresses she tries on.'

item.title: Matt Hancock grilled over envoy role for 'homophobe' Tony Abbott
item.description: Health Secretary Matt Hancock struggled as he was challenged over Mr Abbott's expected appointed to a post-Brexit role.
